title: Kikuyu Alphabet, Basic Greetings, and Vocabulary CAT
description: This Continuous Assessment Test evaluates knowledge of Kikuyu phonology, numerals, time expressions, and cultural communication norms.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] Which of the following statements about Kikuyu vowels is TRUE?
options: Kikuyu vowels change depending on stress.
Kikuyu vowels retain their full sound regardless of stress.
Kikuyu vowels behave like English vowels.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] What is the phonemic significance of vowel length in Kikuyu?
options: It adds beauty but doesn't change meaning.
It can change the meaning of a word.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] Which of these represents a Kikuyu consonant digraph?
[Pronunciation and Alphabets] Which is a unique feature of Kikuyu consonants?
options: They include plosives like "g" and fricatives like "th."
They are identical to English ones.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] What role does tone play in Kikuyu pronunciation?
options: It changes the meaning of words.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] Why is the letter “C” not common in Kikuyu writing?
options: It is only used for foreign words.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] Which of these is incorrectly paired with its Kikuyu phonetic description?
[Pronunciation and Alphabets] In Kikuyu, how does tone affect the word “gũtirĩ”?
options: It changes it from negative to affirmative.
It turns it into a question.

questions.question: [Pronunciation and Alphabets] Which of the following pronunciation features does NOT add to Kikuyu phonological complexity?
[Pronunciation and Alphabets] What is the best method for mastering Kikuyu pronunciation?
options: Practice with native speakers and listen actively.
Translate word for word from English.
